primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades a non-innocent, fearful world to redeem a people who are currently 'numb' or 'lost' through the incarnation of the Son of God.

tekstueel_bewijs: God has entered the womb of a poor, lowly village girl
The Lord God of Israel has visited and redeemed his people
The Father has come seeking for all his children

object.identificatie: Redemption/Deliverance from fear, numbness, and guilt
tekstueel_bewijs: delivered from the hand of our enemies
deliver us from numbness and from fear and from guilt
give light to those who sit in darkness

zender.identificatie: The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob
tekstueel_bewijs: Mary has received a message from the God of Israel

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'lost and frightened child' / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: he has a place set at his table with your own name on it
to give knowledge of salvation to his people

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / Mary / John the Baptist
tekstueel_bewijs: the Holy Spirit filled her with the knowledge
Mary is a model of the true disciple
John the Baptist kick the message to kingdom come
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; the Spirit is the internal Helper/Enabler.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but a 'shadow of death' and a systemic 'numbness' that prevents the reception of reality.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the believer to spread the word and serve in holiness.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (The 'You' who already believe)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Spreading the word / Serving without fear
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/witness) is explicitly fueled by the success of the primary program (God's deliverance).

voorbeelden_god_subject: He will deliver us from numbness
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we are insulated from disagreeable reality

voorbeelden: we need to know as a matter of life and death
None of us wants to mess up the Christmas spirit
to give knowledge of salvation to his people
this news is able to transfigure the ugliest shepherds
being delivered... might serve him without fear

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' of God to transfigure reality, contrasting it with the 'Inability' of human sentimentality to save.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S1 (Sentimentality) to S2 (The reality of Sin/Death) and finally to S1 (The Truth of the Incarnation).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God entering the 'shadow of death' (S2) to bring 'light' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; sin is described as 'violated pregnant women dead in ditches' and 'the shadow of death'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. While it calls for human response, that response is framed as a participation in what God has already initiated.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Mary is a model of the true disciple.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Father has come seeking for all his children.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Mary is presented as a model, but her 'greatness' is immediately tied to her hearing and believing a message *from* God, not her own inherent virtue.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by focusing on God's action in Mary's womb rather than Mary's merit.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and hope; moving from fear/numbness to being 'sought' by a Father.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation with a synergistic witness.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Mindless Fluffland' of the world to the 'Visitation' of God is seamless and logically consistent.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'already' of the believers in the room and the 'not yet' of the Christmas Eve crowd.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: delivered from the hand of our enemies... scattered the proud

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'knowledge' (Savoir) and 'joy' (Vouloir) to Elizabeth.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an insulating numbness and a 'shadow of death' that humans cannot escape on their own.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's 'visitation'. The hearer is positioned as the beneficiary of a rescue mission.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic grace structure.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Death/Numbness) is already sufficiently heavy.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in avoiding moralism by unmasking 'cheap' sentimentality and replacing it with the 'costly' reality of the Incarnation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of the 'Mindless Fluffland' metaphor; Greimas shows that this metaphor functions as the 'Opponent' in the actantial struggle for Truth.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Luke 1; Greimas shows how the sermon casts the modern hearer into the role of the 'lost child' being sought by the 'Father'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-Switch'—moving from the human subject trying to feel 'innocent' to the Divine subject who 'visits and redeems'.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (visits, redeems, enters, shows strength, scatters, puts down, fills, sends, comes seeking, delivers)
We (are insulated, are numbed, are frauds)
appendices.notities: The sermon successfully uses the 'Opponent' of sentimentality to heighten the 'Object' of real, gritty redemption.
